headline: On the Virtue of Testing Systems
author: Publius
preview: It is a truth universally acknowledged among those who labor in the construction of mechanical systems, that no edifice of logic may be trusted until it has been subjected to rigorous trial.
content:
It is a truth universally acknowledged among those who labor in the construction of mechanical systems, that no edifice of logic may be trusted until it has been subjected to rigorous trial.

The prudent architect tests each beam before the roof is raised. So too must we, who build systems of information and automation, verify our constructions before declaring them fit for purpose.

Let this brief essay serve as proof that the mechanism functions as designed, carrying our words from submission to publication without corruption or loss.
